title: Game freezing my computer after Winning/Losing a game
body:
Hello, my computer keeps freezing after I win/lose a game. Basically what happens is I click on the "Continue" button when the game is over, then my screen turns black and a white window on the upper left hand of my screen keeps flashing for about 5 seconds, then I hear a sound that plays when something is disconnected, then my computer freezes. I tried every command in the book but nothing un-freezes it. I downloaded Hextech Repair Tool and re-installed the newest patch released, then I restarted my computer and started up another game to see if it fixed the problem. (Spoiler Alert: It didn't) So I basically have just given up playing until I fix this because I don't want to keep hard-resetting my computer just to play another game. Hope some of you can help.

My PC Specs (Things I think are important)

OS Name	Microsoft Windows 10 Home
Version	10.0.10586 Build 10586
System Type	x64-based PC
Processor	Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-4770K CPU @ 3.50GHz, 3501 Mhz, 4 Core(s), 8 Logical Processor(s)

replies.body:
I'm seeing an increasing number of players on Windows 10 seeing issues with system freezes and game crashes. A lot of them report disabling the new game DVR feature that was enabled by the anniversary update for windows was able to resolve the issue. You can do so with [this walkthrough.](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html)

Let me know if this helped.

It actually didn't work, it worked for 1 game but after that it kept doing the same thing except there wasn't a white box, it was just a black screen, I checked to make sure the game DVR feature was still off and it was.

Hmm.. It sounds like there may be a problematic driver or some windows issues that are contributing to this. In this case, I recommend working through [this guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) to address some common fixes.

Let me know if those steps caused any change.

Alright I did #1, #3, #4, #5, #6 (Except for disabling Aero) #9, #10, and #11. I didn't do the others because I wan't to have sound while I play, my computer isn't overheating, and I wan't very good in-game quality. But it worked for 1 game so far. I will let you know again if it continues. If not, thank you so much for helping me, I really appreciate it.

I'm having this happen as well.  Win 10, Nvidia 860, i7 4700.  Has been happening since around the last windows update/league update, I can't be sure which.  However I'm unfamiliar with rolling back win 10 updates.  As far as I can tell, windows 10 doesn't like you telling your computer what to do.
